data.title: U.S. Congressional Research Agency Raises Policy Issues Such as Allowing Cryptocurrency Companies to Directly Access the Federal Reserve's Main Account
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News The U.S. Congressional Research Service (CRS) released a report on the Federal Reserve's policy issues, which involved the topics of cryptocurrency and digital currency and outlined some policy issues that Congress may want to consider, including: whether cryptocurrency companies and other non-traditional companies with federal or state banking licenses should be granted direct access to the Federal Reserve's discount window and master account. It is reported that the Federal Reserve previously refused to provide a master account in a legal dispute with Custodia Bank. The U.S. Congressional Research Service is a government organization responsible for outlining issues that the U.S. Congress may want to consider. In addition, the relevant report also involves some other crypto issues, including banks' participation in cryptocurrency business, stablecoins and central bank digital currencies (CBDC). (ledgerinsights)

data.title: U.S. Congress Research Service Explores Federal Reserve Policy on Cryptocurrency
data.description: According to Odaily, the U.S. Congressional Research Service (CRS) has released a report addressing Federal Reserve policy issues, focusing on cryptocurrency and digital currency topics. The report outlines several policy considerations that Congress may wish to explore. Among these is whether cryptocurrency companies and other non-traditional firms with federal or state banking licenses should be granted direct access to the Federal Reserve's discount window and main accounts. Previously, the Federal Reserve denied main account access in a legal dispute with Custodia Bank. The CRS, a government organization, is responsible for outlining topics that the U.S. Congress may consider. The report also covers other cryptocurrency-related issues, including bank involvement in cryptocurrency activities, stablecoins, and central bank digital currencies (CBDCs).

data.title: Analyst: Bitcoin's current consolidation cycle may last until the end of February, and then it may rise to $120,000
Analyst: POL's key support level may be at $0.28
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News Analyst Ali Martinez wrote on the X platform: "Some people will understand, others will say it's contradictory. But the key support for POL may be $0.28."

data.title: Analyst Highlights Key Support Level For POL
data.description: According to Odaily, analyst Ali Martinez shared insights on the X platform, stating that while opinions may vary, the crucial support level for POL is identified at $0.28.

data.title: Gate.io Innovation Zone Deposit and Listing Activity Launched $MAGT (MarsAgent)
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News According to official news, the Gate.io Innovation Zone recharge and listing activity has launched the Meme project $MAGT (MarsAgent) at 19:00 (UTC+8) on February 5. Users can help $MAGT to be listed on the Gate.io Innovation Zone by recharging tokens. The prize pool size is 10,000 USDT.

data.title: Avalanche network daily active addresses exceed 250,000
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News According to IntoTheBlock data, the daily active addresses of the Avalanche (AVAX) network have exceeded 250,000, the highest level of on-chain activity since May 2023.

data.title: South Korean elders need Bitcoin, Ether ETFs, finance industry chief says
data.description:
The finance industry association chief vows to list a crypto ETF in 2025 on the domestic exchange to satisfy the growing demand for digital assets among older investors.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/south-korea-needs-bitcoin-and-ether-etfs-finance-industry-says?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound

data.title: Riot Platforms: Mining output of 527 BTC in January, Bitcoin holdings reached 18,221
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News: Riot Platforms, a Nasdaq-listed mining company, published a post on the X platform saying that it produced 527 BTC in January. Despite the rising difficulty of the network, the output continued to increase for the second consecutive month, and the current Bitcoin holdings reached 18,221.

data.title: The increase in BTC mining difficulty has led to a decline in production of most mining companies in January, with Hut 8's monthly decline reaching 27%
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News Due to the continued increase in the difficulty of network mining, the output of most Bitcoin mining companies in January has declined. The output of miners including Hut 8, Mara and Bitrfarms in January has decreased compared with the last month of 2024. Compared with December 2024, Hut 8's monthly Bitcoin output fell by 27%, Mara's and Bitfarms' monthly Bitcoin output fell by 12.5% ​​and 4.7% respectively, but Riot Platforms' Bitcoin mining output rose by 2.1% against the trend. (Cointelegraph)
